Thought it was a fine movie based on a comic book. Never read the comics so didn't have preconceived notions about it. There will be no Oscar nominations from it (wink wink) but who wants that in a movie such as this. I wanted to be entertained and was. My kids also loved it. I've read reviews saying the movie was cheesy and it was, but really so has every movie based on a comic book. That's kind of what Ienjoy about them. I very much recommend this for people that aren't going to take it seriously. If you want that go rent "The Piano" or something. Want to have some fun with the kids...have a good time with this one. Had some scary moments so use your own judgment if your kids can handle it. Mine did fine but lots of folks getting burned up and changing into monsters and stuff.

this movie opened a new field in cinematography. it's a comedy without them actually telling you it's one, so you can enjoy it in two totally different ways, depending on your affinities. although, if your looking for this type of entertainment i'd rather recommend 'breakfast at tiffany's'.but that's just a bonus (no extra charge). the real genius of the movie lies in the fact that they managed to animate nicolas cage without anyone noticing! - Japanese people you can kiss our white, Christian, round-eyed, not-all-black-haired, much nicer and more masculine bums!OK, i must admit, if you look REALLY REALLY close you might find some flaws. for instance, it's not recommendable for children (not even if your the devil himself). then it might make you sell your soul for eternal imprisonment of ego and thus lead a linear and mechanized life deprived from a phenomena some prefer to as empathy. also, it lacks a sense of devotion, creativity, originality, belief that people haven't forgotten terminator 2, about 40 million dollars and goggles more of ingredients a decent blockbuster Otha have.
I still have no clue how he rode that ghost and it gives me nighmares

Ghost Rider seems to be just the pilot episode of a series. The whole movie (nearly 2 hours!) is spent in detailing how Johny blaze became the character portrayed in the comics, which leads to a very slow movie with no character development at all (in spite of seeing 20 years of their lives during the film) and no suspense at all.The CGI effects are good, and used carefully except in the case of the bad guys. With this ones there's just "hey, we're the bad, hate us". But they're so plain and powerless that in they become pitiful opponents.Finally, in spite of Cage's and Mendes' efforts the movie doesn't convey any emotion at all, it's the same if they're teens in love, or haven't seen each other for years, or whatever. No blazing sentences, no humor, no chemistry between the characters. A disaster of a script.Well, I believe that's all. If they finally make a real movie instead of this pilot episode maybe I'll watch it on TV. I won't give more money to this character on theaters. It's a pity, because I liked X-Men movies, Hellboy and even Daredevil, but this Ghost Rider sets the standard in comic-adapted movies really low.
This movie is intelligently put together. The plot is engaging and crafty, and I appreciate the magnificent performance on Nicolas Cage's part.

This is a good movie for a laugh. But sadly enough for the director, it is a laugh on the movie not because of the movie! The movie is full of clichés to the degree that while I was watching it with a friend, we were able to expect the following sentence and, guess what, we were right most of the times.! The plot is clear and stupid. The acting is unconvincing. Maybe, the special effects were the only power thing in this movie. However, believe me, special effects don't make a movie of nothing. Don't expect that I took the movie very seriously or something. No, I expected it to be just a entertaining 2 hours of time but, again, the movie failed to deliver these two hours. Thanks god I didn't watch the movie alone cuz it would have been the most boring two hours of my life.

First off, let me say that I am a fan of Marvel movies. There have been a few flops in the past, i.e. Hulk, but this one takes the cake. I am also a Nicholas Cage fan but was very surprised not only to see how his acting has deteriorated over the past films, but the fact had he accepted this role with such a poorly written script and previous flops in the box office. The acting was horrendous from almost every actor especially Eva Mendes. There was no connection between the characters to make the audience feel the acting was natural. The film ran way too long and I watched several people leave the theater half way through it. The first half was slow with no substance and didn't start to pickup until half past. I remember thinking the whole time that I would benefit more from this movie by closing my eyes and taking a nap. I've never been so upset at a Marvel movie much less Nicholas Cage (for taking this role) and how this movie seemed to get pushed through without anyone screening it to realize its crap. I even bought the Hulk when it came out on DVD just because it was a Marvel movie but this is certainly one that will not go on my shelf. IF ANYTHING, wait until this comes out on DVD. It's not worth the wait or the hype (if there even is hype after opening day).

I'm not into much of the movies made from Comics... but this one was great. Kept me interested the whole time and of course my most favorite actor was in it Nicolas Cage... he has such a great personality for his character in this movie. The way he turns from Johnny Blaze to Ghost Rider was very cool and the bike was awesome! I do believe I have a favorite comic book character now. My husband likes the Punisher but I think I have grown fond of the Ghost Rider, the story behind this movie is really interesting and there are so many action packed scenes that I didn't get bored one bit. Loved this movie has become one of my favorites.

And it was awesome. Seriously, wasn't expecting to have such a good time with it after all the internet bitching. It's a straight on popcorn flick, unabashedly pure fun. Was nice to see something like that after all of the recent academy flicks. Nicolas Cage is back in a big way. He goes totally mental when he changes into the Ghost Rider -- you have to see it! Screaming and laughing while his skin is exploding and burning, it's intense (surprisingly so for a PG13). Sam Elliott is one of my favorite actors and he does an awesome job as well. And Wes BEntley (where has he been?) shows that he remains one of the best actors of his generation. Eva Mendes is hot!!!!! There were so many huge set pieces here -- the biggest one would be a spoiler so I won't give it. But the final fight is awesome, reminded me of Raiders of the Lost Ark with the spirits flying all over the place. Warning to kids thought -- it's scary at times. Pay attention to the rating!

Let's get it out of the way upfront, I am a huge fan of the Ghost Rider comics but I still found this movie to be very, very average.The first 5 minutes were bad, then after Johnny sold his soul to save Barton Blaze (whoops! what happened to Crash Simpson?) who died in one of the lamest crashes ever caught on film I knew I was in for some serious suckage.What do film studios seem to consistently think that they can take a proved hit comic book script and throw it all out the window and totally rewrite the script to make a 'better' movie? The Ghost Rider effects were cool, the fights totally lame, the story was also lame while at the same time being inconsistent with the comics and the dialogue was generally dreadful. On the plus side, Eva Mendes must have the most gorgeous rack in modern cinema, this alone should keep the young male fans entertained.Where was the love story? Where was the witty, cowboyesque banter? Where was the Blaze/GR duality? The struggle between GR and Satan for his soul? Sorry all cut to make the story 'better' *cough* *cough* *hurl* In the end I give this movie 5 stars, 4 stars for finally seeing GR on the big screen, 3 stars for Eva Mendes' boobies and -2 stars for choosing Nicholas Cage as Johnny Blaze/Ghostrider. And if we total all this up that's correct if I wasn't a huge GR fan this would be a 1! They must have hired the guys that made The Phantom to ruin this one.

Review title: A few cool moments surrounded by many awful ones
Review_body: I had pretty high expectations for this movie, but I was completely wrong. I must say, however, that the effects for this movie were very well done. I thought ghost rider look pretty real, or at least as real as a skeleton on fire can look. This couldn't save the movie though. It had one good actor (Nicholas Cage) surrounded by bad ones. Mix this in with a confusing storyline that was just stupid and you get a complete flop. I was also disappointed that Stan Lee was not in this. He was in some of the other Marvel movies like X-Men and Spider-man, but not this one. He probably thought that it was so bad that he did not want to waste his time being in it.

This movie is freaking hot! And 'Hot' would be the correct word. I just saw it tonight with my dad, and lets just say it will be a while before we forget it. Sure, the speeches were predictable and cheesy, but the music definitely fits the movie. If you find the soundtrack, but it ASAP. The story line goes like this: meet 17-year-old Jonny Blaze, an up and coming motorcycle daredevil who does shows with his dad in the circus. Problem is that his dad is a chain smoker and has cancer. Jonny unknowing makes a deal with the devil, and though the cancer is gone, his dad dies in a freak "accendent." Flash forward, Jonny Blaze is the name to know. He makes jumps that other daredevils wouldn't think of or try. While planning to jump over six helicopters, he meets up again with his old sweetheart who is of course a reporter. While preparing for their date, Jonny meets up with the devil wants again. The devil has a problem. His son has escaped hell, and plans on ruling earth with the help of this contract hidden from the devil long ago by a former Ghost Rider. And the son's not alone in this quest. He has some help in the way of the a bunch of meanies of earth, water, and air. The devil wants Jonny to stop his son before he reaches the contract. Jonny then unwilling becomes the new Ghost Rider and rips up the streets with his motorcycle. This is the one movie this year you can't afford to miss. The effects are awesome, and it makes you believe that fire is the number one element you cant' defeat, no matter what you're made of. P.S. Nick Cage is definitely the guy for this part. Don't let anyone tell you different.

Review title: Closest Marvel Movie to Comic Book Yet
Review_body: This film shows how versatile of an actor Cage can be. He demonstrates, to me, an Oscar worthy performance. The story line follows the original Ghost Rider comic book almost exact, not to mention it's an incredible thrill ride. The special effects are amazing. If you enjoy watching a film for its pure beauty, this movie is for you. Between the camera angles, transitions and scenery; it makes totally worth seeing. People may think that the entire Ghost Rider is CG the entire time, i feel this is not true, he looks to good, or maybe it was just amazing CG. I waited years for this film to come out. Now that it has, i feel that it was well worth the wait. If you don't want to spend so much money to go see a movie, or if you only see one movie a year, make sure this is the movie that you see. The story line, the acting, the soundtrack, and the SFX are so extraordinary. All in all I would highly recommend this movie to everyone.

I saw Ghost Rider tonight and it was pretty much what I thought it would be. The special effects were alright, they could have been a lot worse but also could have been a lot better. You don't get to see Ghost Rider until like 40-50 minutes in so in a way it's kind of like the movie the Hulk were you don't get to see the Hulk until almost half the movie is over. And of course there's the stereotypical love story. There wasn't really even chemistry between the characters Johnny Blaze and Roxanne and I think the movie suffered for it. And every time Eva Mendes was on screen, every shirt she just so happened to be wearing showed a lot of cleavage but no complaints from me. The weirdest part about this movie is from the trailer is makes it seem like Nicolas Cage is totally wrong for the part and cheesy and don't forget old but surprisingly enough he does an alright job and did what he could for the role he was given. I think a lot of people are gonna compare this movie to Daredevil and say it's just as bad but for a movie about a B-list superhero that really a lot of people don't even know, it's not that bad. It kept me entertained throughout and I recommend it to anybody who likes a good cheesy superhero movie. And don't take it too serious, Ghost Rider is no Spider-Man movie.

I was not a huge Ghost Rider fan as a kid. I believe the only true exposure i had to the character was in a series (going from memory here) where he teamed up with Vengeance. As a comic movie Ghost Rider for me ranked along the lines of other lesser known heros including Hellboy, Blade, and Punisher. A very solid popcorn flick complete with cheesetastic dialogue and fleeting moments of true talent. The problem for me about the movie didn't stem from any of the performances. The weakest link in the chain was Wes Bently as Blackheart. I'm unsure if this was due to his delivery or the material he was given. It's very easy for a comic book villain to come off as campy in movies if not given the proper treatment. The special effects were great but for me the battles with the villains weren't as spectacular as i expected. I don't want to post any spoilers but it hardly seemed anyone was much of a challenge for the rider.

Don't believe the Hate. I am astounded to see so many hating on Nic Cage and this movie. Especially after seeing it the other night. That's right, I actually SAW the movie unlike some of the w*nkers on these boards. If you don't like the movie, that's fine, that's valid. But I'm shocked at how many of these so-called reviewers are writing in after clearly not seeing the film. Blackheart doesn't transform? Scarecrow is a crappy villain? Maybe. But we'll never know since he's not in the film to begin with! The action, as you may already suspect, is full on! Some of the best action and fight scenes that I've ever seen. The audience I saw the film with was way into it -- audible gasps and laughter at all of the appropriate spots. Granted, this was a cast and crew screening for the locals. But in my experience those are usually the worst screenings as everyone is obsessing over their work instead of just enjoying the film. It's a full on roller coaster ride and the kind of movie you can't download or watch on DVD and get the full effect. Sorry, but when I go to the movies I want to be swept away into a fantasy world and that's what the filmmakers have done. Cage (and what IS is with all that hate?) is hilarious -- reminded me of Face Off how big he went and crazy things got. The movie rides the line of camp throughout but never goes too far. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT.p.s. My mate was on 2nd unit for this so props to them!!!

Review title: Misses the Mark by a Mile
Review_body: Ghost Rider is a movie comprised entirely of missed opportunities and faulty logic. The character has outstanding potential. He is a tortured man who must deal with the demon inside him to work towards redemption. This is a great source of conflict on a personal and metaphysical scale. And though Cage does well to express Johnny Blaze's torment in the beginning of the film, by the time Ghost Rider appears the movie begins to spiral completely out of control.The characterization screeches to a halt after this and any interaction between the hero and the villain is reduced to inane schoolyard banter: Ghost Rider: "You're going down" Blackheart: "I don't think so. Na na na poo poo." There is no wit or depth to any of the verbal interactions between the hero and the villains. Tired and pathetic lines like "you can't catch the wind" or "he wasn't so tough" seem like they were lifted from rather poor written comics. Just because Ghost Rider comes from an occasionally simplistic medium doesn't mean that the dialogue must be flat and lacking in invention.Nor is there any logic. When the "water demon" pulls Nic Cage underwater in an attempt to drown him, Cage turns into Ghost Rider and yells, "Surprise!" and defeats the creature in a matter of seconds. I'm not quite sure how this is a surprise since Cage has been turning into Ghost Rider for the whole movie. Doing it again is hardly shocking.The one hope that the movie could be visually stunning and have great fight scenes was dashed by the lackluster and unimaginative effects. Ghost Rider's fights with the villains were always pathetically short and lacking in punch. Stylistic action was replaced with simplicity. If Ghost Rider wraps his chain around a villain, they die. No fuss, no muss. The fight is over. There is no grand heroic slug fest that delights the viewer with explosions and senseless visual wonder. Instead we are treated to Ghost Rider throwing flaming balls of sand. Delightful. Even Fantastic Four makes this movie look beautiful.The one fantastic point of the film was that Ghost Rider looked good. He looked really good. Hell, even Sam Elliot's western Ghost Rider looked good. All this despite the fact that the character grandly transformed, rode to the scene of the final battle, and then inexplicably left without doing much of anything. Nice plot twist.The casting is also extremely unimpressive. Wes Bentley never manages to be more that slightly creepy as Blackheart. He is far from being an intimidating villain. He instead channels his creepy film student from American Beauty. He looks like he should be worrying about protecting his lunch money instead of gaining control of hell. Peter Fonda plays the devil, Mephisto, and also manages to remain thoroughly unimpressive despite the aid of numerous digital effects and the fact that everything gets cold when he is near.I wish I could express all of this movie's failings and I feel the above summary of my grievances does not accurately depict the horror and anguish I felt while watching this film. I feel that the character deserves something more. I feel that he deserves epic battles, emotional turmoil, and above all some better dialogue that comes from a dictionary instead of a nursery school. If you want to see it, see it. And then perhaps you can flesh out my line of complaints.

You'd think that when you hear a movie where the plot is a man who sold his soul to the devil that it would be a dark movie, well in the case of Ghost Rider you'd be wrong. I was hoping for a Spawn type feel since the plot is quite similar, but a miss usage of jokes instantly killed that dream. The one thing I liked about Ghost Rider was the one thing I liked about Spider-Man 2 great effects. The bad things where also a lot like Spider-Man 2. What kind of Devil chooses a professional stunt driver as their bounty hunter? Well I know Malabogia from Spawn didn't, he choose a man who was a ruthless killer born and bread. Why does Nicholas Cage have to over act so much in this movie, and why is his voice so low when he pointed at Mephisto I was laughing so hard, btw that's not supposed to be funny. And what kind of an official bounty hunter for satin eats Jeally Beans out of a Martini Glass. See I can take a little bit of humor in Action movies, but this and Spider-Man 2 over did it way too much especially in this movie. Why was Mephisto's name Mephistoles, I'm not 100% sure but I think that's not the original name for the character. I do love Caretaker though, but mostly because I'm a big fan of The Big Labowski. Also why with the special effects of today they can't make Black Heart look like his awesome self instead of a half-ass version? All in all I give Ghost Rider 3/10, that 3 is only for when Cage turns into the Ghost Rider, which wasn't a lot, I thought he looked really cool.

Review title: A good popcorn flick with a healthy dollop of cheese......
Review_body: I agree 100% with w00f's previous comments - not Oscar material by any stretch but check your brain at the lobby and go along for the ride.The bad acting that, it has to be said, is prevalent throughout the movie (especially by Wes Bentley, I feel) can be forgiven if it is taken in the context in which it is intended, i.e a comic book strip. It plays out exactly like a comic book of old with menacing close-ups of the villains eyes and over-exerted facial expressions and cheesy dialogue abounding. Whether this can translate effectively into a movie is still open to debate but for my part, I reckon that the cast and crew have made a fine attempt at carrying it off.It's a bit slow to start, can be irritating if taken too seriously but is ultimately, viewed with the right attitude, a good fun action movie with some nice effects.Oh, and did I mention that Eva Mendes is BEYOND fine in this movie...? Never really been a fan before but HOT DAMN!! If for nothing else, it's worth a look just for her......

Of course one must start out to state how hard it truly is to portray a comic super hero on film. to even think that one would attempt to put together a motion picture such as ghost rider would seem to be preposterous. I will gladly say that i was very pleased with the outcome of this motion picture. i was a little worried at first that the graphics would not be up to par. but i do believe that they looked pretty good. i think the director portrayed a great vision of the ghost rider and Nicolas cage did an outstanding job in playing him. over all i rate this movie a good 9.5. i look forward to the future. i believe this film has great sequel potential.

So many reasons the movie was bad, but lets just go through some of my top ten. In no real order:10. Eva Mendes shows us cleavage throughout the movie, except for the last scene. I enjoyed this aspect and had a good laugh about it throughout the film but why have her buttoned up at the end and only at the end, how about some consistency. 9. Fight scenes were god awful. I was hoping the last fight would be something worth sticking around for, but it was only marginally better then the rest. Why was it so bad, cause there was no exchange of punches in battle, each battle lasted only a minute. GR was never in any danger, hell a street thug did more damage than any of the demons. The sun was probably his worst enemy.8. The demons hiding in different elements, what was with them. They sucked, sure they looked cool, but they couldn't fight their way out of a paper bag. The first scene with them has them all lined up and posing. Hey guys, you have the whole bar, why not spread out, this isn't an ad for jeans. They couldn't fight, and each fight scene only made the movie longer than it should have been.7. The first time GR transforms it was done really well. I enjoyed it, but after that he turned into GR in a second, no skin melting or anything. 6. The dialog, dear lord why couldn't it have been a silent movie. My favorite line had to be "A man who believes in love, is a man who can change the world". Then gave Johnny Blaze the contract for the 1000 souls and possibly the end of the world. I laughed so hard I was crying.5. Was that the bonanza theme I heard as both the Ghost Riders rode off. 4. Why did Sam Elliot just disappear. He rode with Johnny Blaze to the town, but that was it. He "had enough for one more transformation", so why didn't he stay as the GH till after the battle, just come out later. My point is why did he just ride with Cages character and use his last transformation for absolutely NO REASON.3. Can Cage please stop doing accents. 2. The love story was so bad, so very bad. 1. The director has a good visual feel, but no substance. There is so much to this story, I don't know how he managed to mess up so badly. This movie was way to long, at least it felt way to long.This movie is made for 10 year olds, and people who know nothing about Ghost Rider. The start of the movie looked really interesting, and they should have stuck to that. Set it in the old west or something. The special effects were decent, the ghosts at the end were done really well, as well as the first transformation. How Blackheart kills his victims was pretty cool. They may have been trying to make a campy movie. If you like campy, and corny (and yes crappy) then this movie may be for you otherwise, beware. This is not only the worst movie I have seen this year, it's the worst movie I have seen in many year.

The beginning was a bit much on the weird side, but all in all I suppose it was OK. It was not what I expected. The whole story could have been more dramatic. Even Spider Man had moments of exceitment and would put you on the edge of your seat. Thats what I thought this movie would be all about. Way to much drama in the fighting scenes. It was as though he was an un-beatble "super hero" who could do no wrong, and never die. Some of the dialog was a bit odd at the end. I just wonder why this movie took such a loooong time to come out. I think it would have been worth while watching if it had a bit more action that was'nt so weird.

I know, I know. 4 out of 10!? How can any Marvel movie possibly get a score that low? Especially one with Nicholas Cage.First, I would like you all to know just how much of a fan I am of the Marvel movies, and that of Mark Steven Johnson. His work on Elektra and Daredevil, although not extraordinary, was certainly worthy of watching. Not to mention his movies haven't really been all that bad...I really hate to say this (Ghostrider is a movie I've been looking forward to for a very long time), but this movie was just... horrible. The acting was incredibly cheesy (yes... even Cage). There were times when I couldn't help but laugh out loud during certain dialogue points, such as when Mephistopheles and Blackheart were "facing off" in the park. The lines were so one-dimensional that it felt like I was watching a parody of an action-movie... like Kung Pow. Every moment of the film felt fake... the emotions (if there were any) seemed paper-thin. Every line can be predicted. It was all too cliché. Eva Meade, the actress who plays Cage's secret love, Roxanne Simpson, didn't make any sense. One second she was walking away from Cage's character, the next she was jumping back into his arms (not to mention her face was nearly expressionless the entire movie).The plot, although good in theory, lacked conflict. Every single showdown that Ghostrider had with the elemental lackeys lasted, at the most, two minutes... literally. There was no challenge... no excitement. Ghostrider did more damage while riding his bike to the fights than he did during them.I would suggest either avoiding this movie completely or at least waiting until it hits the 2-dollar theater. I would have given Ghostrider a lower score if not for the extraordinary graphics (although the cool scenes are mainly of Cage riding his bike, not the fights).

I've heard that Nicolas Cage offered to pay for a chance to audition to be Ghostrider. It shows -- the man clearly loves the character, and is obviously having a ball playing Johnny Blaze.The special effects were spectacular. I particularly enjoyed the transformations from Johnny Blaze to Ghostrider, which were nicely handled, and the demons -- especially the water demon.The writing could have been a bit better. I enjoyed the movie enough to forgive the few problems I noticed. There were a couple of scenes that left you saying, "Wait -- what?" but the movie was entertaining enough and fast-paced enough that you could generally over-look those bits and just enjoy the ride. The characters suffered somewhat due to the fast pace, though, I think. A lot of movie time was necessarily spent on back story, and setting up the plot, but some character development, especially Roxanne's, suffered for it. She ended up basically being a cookie-cutter love interest.Over all, I must say that I enjoyed the movie. It was funny, scary in places, action-packed, and generally an all-around good time. I expect that fans of the book will complain about the canon having been "butchered", but frankly, you have to expect some rewriting of the history. Any comic good enough to rate a movie is going to have a metric ton of history behind it, and you have to rewrite and truncate that history to fit it into a ninety minute movie. I think the writers did quite well with Ghostrider's back story, and I think they did a great job with the movie over all. Here's hoping for sequels!

Review title: Ghost Rider is not to shabby
Review_body: The film is actually good. The storyline is creative and it kinda catches your attention. Both Nicholas Cage and Eva Mendes give great performances. Nicholas Cage, I feel, pulled off the Johnny Blaze character and made it work. Ghost Rider looks visually stunning, and the special effects are impressive. It felt like the film moved pretty fast, but it didn't lose it's direction. This film isn't a 'knock you out of your shoes' blockbuster, but it can stand on it's own. Compared to other comic movies, I would have to say this one stands a little higher than the Punisher film starring Thomas Jane. Ghost Rider leaves you wanting a little more. Check it out...you'll be delightfully surprised.

As a long time Ghost Rider fan, I was willing to overlook a lot on this movie. For one thing it is comic-book based and people should not expect it to be full of profound acting. However I was only actually impressed by Sam Elliot as Caretaker. Nicolas Cage was next, he did as good a job as he could under the constraints of the direction and script. Peter Fonda was impressive due to camera angles, shots and props, rather than really being allowed to shine through his own effort. Eva Mendes was just OK but there was no real chemistry between her and Cage; guys will enjoy looking at her ever-present cleavage. Wes Bentley as Blackheart, son of Mephistopheles, was totally unconvincing and as a villain utterly unimpressive. The NY Post, which rarely gets anything right, accurately described his look as "rockabilly Eddie Munster". His henchmen, the Hidden, were equally without any gravity as villains, leaving a real hole where a nice hateable villain should be (except for Fonda/Mephistopheles).On the positive side, the action and effects kept me glued to the screen for more; speaking as a long time GR fan, the way they did his transformation, his flame cycle (even the sound) and his action scenes were very cool and satisfying! At least 4 times during the movie the audience in my theater broke out into applause, all during great special effect or action scenes, such as the first time Johnny Blaze turns into Ghost Rider.I did laugh out loud at several (intentionally) funny moments; but this movie was all over the map and not consistent in what balance of action, horror, camp and comic relief to aim for. There wasn't enough horror or tension to call for that much comic relief.This movie is worth seeing on the big screen for the spectacle; it is fun and I am glad I saw it. I think Nic Cage and Sam Elliot were the right choices for their characters. However I was disappointed in the villains and supporting characters for the most part and they were bad enough to distract me even during the "comic book movie" I had anticipated.

Review title: i feel bad for nicholas cage
Review_body: as a huge comic book fan and knowing nicholas cage is one. i feel really sorry for him. he should've seen this horrible movie coming. the idea of it was great as it is a great comic book. where they went wrong was hiring the director/writer who did two of the crappiest comic book movies in the history of film(daredevil & elektra). this would've been a great movie if it was in the hands of either the director of batman begins or bryan singer. this director seemed to bring the worst performances and most drab dialogue out of some really good actors. i was so looking forward to this film only to shake my head and predict the next crappy line all through it.

Review title: really wish i hadn't wasted my money on it
Review_body: This movie was such a disappointment, The dialog was horrible, the acting, overdone, and the "comedic scenes"...well lets just say that i have seen better. Nicholas caige really wasn't fit for the part and he did most of the overacting. Come one! he should have just played it the way he did in Gone in 60 seconds. Blackheart, well, he did some pretty freaky stuff, but at least he had great computer graphics. His minions were gross too, and all the broken dialog made me feel like i was watching rain man. And some things did NOT make sense. Nicholas gets stabbed while he is on fire and when he changes back, he has a wound. 50 cops shoot the guy and not a scratch on him. It wasn't as bad as ultraviolet but it was getting there. two thumbs waayy down.

This movie is awesome. The CGI and the acting are suburb. If your expecting to go see an Oscar winning movie go see something else, because this movie rocked. I have been a Ghostrider fan for 20 some odd years now and while the comic has changed over the years shifting with the changing times and new characters it is still a great story... The movie has the same characteristics. The movie is updated for '07 and plays out like any Rider fan's dream. My only complaint was it was too short. I hope to see another movie in the future staring Nick Cage our beloved anti-hero. If you went and saw the Incredible Hulk and were left feeling a little disappointed fear not this movie should allay your fears of another bad Marvel make IE.. Fantastic 4, Hulk, and DareDevil (possibly).See it and love it.And if your planing on taking your girl to the movie ... DON'T unless you want to spend the entire movie explaining everything to her, like the people who sat behind me .

Review title: Just because it's a comic book movie doesn't mean that it shouldn't be serious
Review_body: First off I kind of enjoyed this movie being a ghost rider fan but then the more I thought about it as a movie fan I lost a lot of faith in Marvels ability to make the proper choices regarding some of their more popular brand names. This movie had a lot of potential and at points it really delivered. One of the weaker links in this film were it's inability to stay true to blackheart an mephisto's characthers. They both fealt more like a soap opera digest version of their comic book companions. The other thing that bothered me were the desert and western town sets. For such a large budget movie they looked oddly like they were filmed in a studio and not out in I don't know a spaghetti western or actual ghost town set in the middle of a desert.My other major complaint about this movie was the acting. I don't claim to be an Eva Mendez fan although I do thoroughly enjoy Nicholas Cage. I have witnessed his acting skill in numerous films and am well aware of his potential. It appeared as though that any and every moment before he is about to redeem himself in his role as Ghost Rider his acting takes a drastic and campy turn for the worse(If he was really such a huge fan he wouldn't have taken the role as Johnny Blaze knowing he wouldn't be able to do it justice).It was almost as if they were reading off of cue cards for some of the more dramatic parts of the film. In my opinion the only one who stayed in character throughout the film was Sam Elliot but who would expect anything less from him.I understand to a point that this movie does not take it self seriously and it is meant more as a fun and easy going cash cow for the marvel movie empire and in that it succeeds. What I don't get is why marvel won't grow a pair and make another movie for adult audiences (like the first Blade) just because a movie has am 18+ or R rating does not mean it can't become a blockbuster. Think about it a movie about a man who sells his soul to the devil and is forced to become his bounty hunter only to experience the endless torments of hell and such by any other name would be directed at an adult audience if marvel is worried about it's more impressionable viewers it always has the Fantastically disappointing Four and the good, good and alright X-men movies.Overall i put this one behind Daredevil (thats right)and X-men but way out in front of Electra and Fantastc Four. On that note I just want to say Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man (if you've seen both the movies you'll know what I am tali-king about)!

Ghost Rider is one of the coolest super hero comic movies ever! I mean people who say the Nicolas cage wont be good in it man are you wrong, it made 44.5 million dollars!!!! the cgi fire is really great and the special effects are awesome, this is a must see movie! I'm only a kid but i like the comics I've already beaten the game and i agree with Nicolas cage enough with the tights and capes. Ghost Rider looks awesome, a skull on fire, a leather jacket with spikes on it, a crazy insanely cool looking motorcycle, a shotgun and a chain thats on fire! In my opinion this is the greatest comic ever! if you don't agree thats alright but if you do you rock!

Review title: Ghost Rider saved my movie-watching soul
Review_body: I went into the theatre with doubts about this movie. There's a tendency in moviedom to draw weak souls like me who love cutting edge graphics, into a C-grade moviemeaning no script with depth, but big buck graphics. Then my inner critic starts moaning about no character depth and no deep thoughts on script writing.Here at home in U.S.A., I needed something to stir my soul, and nothing does it better that a real good fight between good and evil. The cast, Sam Eliot gets my top actor vote, Peter Fonda (the still smooth, EasyRider guy). Innocent, as innocence goes and great acting, "Roxie," with "Johnny-Nick-Cage-Blaze" (BTW, Nick, my faith is restored-excellent acting and glad you got the part).Thank you, thank you, thank you producers, cast, writers, Marvel, everyone, for creating, doing, acting and putting your hearts and souls in Ghost Rider.No lame-horse acting and no broke-down script in Ghost Rider. Loved it! Will see it again and again.

I have just been to see the movie and I found that going into it I was skeptical as I knew the characters history and with the reviews being more neg the positive , I hoped for the best. I was happy and very pleased with the total production. The effects were amazing and the character history and development were well done that even if a person had no background information they could walk in and see the movie and understand the character.I have see all the movies that took comic book characters and displayed them on the big screen and this is one that was more true to the original story and did not do a hatchet job to the character of the supporting characters, I think the production team did an excellent job and as far as Nicholas Cage in the lead role I was skeptical about that but it was handled by a professional and he made it work.I give the film two big flaming thumbs up and it is one hell of a hellcycle ride from start to finish.Never mind what some of the negative reviews say GhostRider is worth the full admission price enjoy it for what it is one very good action adventure movie, and Sam Elliot was wonderful as the caretaker.So enjoy or not it is really up to you to decide.

Review title: Very Good...but had a few problems
Review_body: I enjoyed this movie very much. Personally, I'm the type that enjoys dark fantasy and spooky creatures. I loved Blackheart...though they did not make him as powerful as he could be.That was my main problem. There just weren't any real fight scenes. I guess movies like Spider-Man and X-men spoiled me. I want to see long battles...not just three spirits getting killed with one blow. I mean...come on...they HAVE to be stronger than that? I thought the idea of Blackheart absorbing all of those souls was sweet..though I was hoping that he would have transformed more. It was still a very cool (and creepy) scene. I liked the Biblical reference to Legion.Other than that, I enjoyed this movie. I laughed at the parts I was supposed to laugh at, and though some were a bit cheesy, I still enjoyed it. When I was asked to explain the movie to a friend, I said "Nicholas Cage...Pointing...A lot!" The Special Effects were amazing, especially the transformation scenes. Nick laughing maniacally reminds me of Face Off. "I like peaces...I like them a lot." Heh. Riding up the building was impressive and my boyfriend and I couldn't help but be impressed by his destruction of the city streets on his first ride. I jumped at the right places as well. Mephisto's appearance out of no where to young JB was surprising.Anyway, it was not the best, but it was still an entertaining ride. I recommend you go see it.

First off, I must say, casting David Hasselhoff as Ghost Rider was an excellent, though unorthodox decision. Combining his fiery badassness with his on screen love interest Jennifer Coolidge (best known for her role as "Stifler's Mom" in the American Pie quasi-trilogy), Ghost Rider is on a mission to regain a contract for Mephistopheles (Christopher Walken), and consequently must fight Blackheart, the son of Mephistopheles, as portrayed by Ben Stiller. This movie is a fiery thrill-ride adventure for all, and features an almost cameo appearance by Chuck Norris as a Texas Ranger, and former Ghost Rider named Carter Slade. Though out of his element as an ex- Texas Ranger, Norris definitely played the part well. I give this movie a ten only because IMDb won't let me give it an eleven, the only thing this movie was lacking was more cowbell.

Review title: One of the worst comic movies yet
Review_body: The storyline behind Ghost Rider was extremely boring and un-interesting. During some of the scenes in the movie I found myself laughing and then realizing the scene was a serious one. The only things worth watching this movie for are the special effects and the attractive, yet boring, character played by Eva Mendes. The movie attempted to make the bad guys so scary to a point where it was laughable and borderline childish. Don't even waste your money on seeing this in the theater. If you're going to see it at all wait for the DVD release and rent it.*potential spoiler* An example of a scene that made no sense: Towards the end of the movie the old ghost rider tells the new one that he's going to come with him to battle whatever demon he's set to take on. They take the 500 mile journey to get there and once they're overlooking the place the old Ghost Rider tells the new one that's he's going to leave him to it. So, basically he just rode 500 miles to turn around and disappear? That made no sense whatsoever.*end spoiler* I can only hope that next week's profits drop drastically and they don't make another one because it doesn't deserve a sequel. I'm not just saying that because I thought it was bad but just looking at the character there is really no where else he can go. It's just going to be the same basic thing over again. I can't say that I won't be surprised to see a sequel because that's just how crazy Hollywood is over the comic book movie genre but it would be a mistake to make another. Drop this character for a more interesting one.

I'm not going to write an extensive summary, but this movie did not live up to its potential or my expectations.The trailers fool everyone into thinking that it would be an amazing experience but its not.The script was cheesy, there was no plot, and some of the characters did the stupidest things i have ever seen. While watching it i counted all the ways in which i could have made it better and the total number of corrections i could have made numbered 253. No joke.Even the acting seemed to suffer due the crappy script. I am a fan of Nicholas Cage, but i have never, ever seen him in such a terrible role. I also happen to think that Eva Mendes is hot, but her low cut shirts weren't even enough to stop me from banging my head against the seat in front of me. (sorry who ever was sitting in front of me).In the end when Ghost Rider confronted the devil again and was told that he could lead a normal life again HE REFUSED!!!! The entire movie was spent building upon his angst and regret that entered such a terrible bargain, and in the end when he was offered normalcy HE REFUSED!!! I have sworn never ever to see another movie by Mark Steven Johnson as long as i live.

Its a Comic book silly ! (said like Captain Jack Sparrow says "Pirate"). For Marvel comic book fans, Nicolas Cage fans and action adventure fans this movie is just downright fun. I always have a good laugh as a decent movie get's eaten up by "artistic" reviewers and then cast, crew and investors cry all the way to the bank. There are some folks who just lose the kid inside where you forget what it was like to invite a good friend over to the house, listen to tunes, read comics, gossip and eat candy and slurp down some sodas. I don't know about you, but I think it would be wicked cool to ride a flaming bike like that up the side of a skyscraper. Sure Traffic, Million Dollar Baby and American Beauty are good movies. You also leave them wanting to jump off of a bridge. I've always loved Sam Elliot and his narration and then portrayal of a key Texas Ranger like character couldn't be better. I liked seeing Peter Fonda again as the devil. Fonda isn't as good as his sister but it was still good to see him in a film again. Eva Mendez was good but I would have liked to see them beef up her part a bit....and I don't know how they squeezed her into her outfit. And of course Cage does all of the Cage type of things that we have come to love and expect. The special effects are fun but I certainly wouldn't rate them as A list.So don't go see this movie with adult types (people who have forgotten how to think like kids). Just bring your best buddy (or budette), get some candy and cokes and sit back and enjoy a fun (and yes light hearted)comic book romp. And yes....I still want one of those bikes!!!!

Review title: Ghost Rider, Worst Marvel Film Yet?
Review_body: A word to Marvel Studios: YOU DON'T NEED TO SHOVE 20 YEARS WORTH OF STORY INTO ONE FILM!!! Do me a favor Marvel Studios, stop trying to give me what I want. Sure, in X-3 I wanted to see Colossus hurl Wolverine into the air and see Iceman "ice-up". Of course in Fantastic Four you want to see Dr. Doom battle the "fave-four" in each of their own elements. And okay, in Hulk the battle at the end of the film between Banner and his father is pretty sweet. Even in Ghost Rider getting a chance to meet the Spirit of Vengenace was worth while. But if all these things come with the sacrifice of a clear story, strong characters, and empowering cinematic awe, then STOP! I want to see a good movie before I see a movie filled with all the things you THINK I want to see. The problems with Ghost Rider is that there was too much. The heart of the film should have been Blaze's struggle to control "the demon within". That's all. Cut out Blackheart, cut out Donal Logue, and most definitely cut out Eva Mendes. There is too much going on, plan and simple. Is the movie about the turmoil between Blaze and Roxanne? Is it about Blaze and Ghost Rider? Blaze and the Devil? Ghost Rider and Blackheart? The Devil and Blackheart? Blaze and the Caretaker? Blaze and his own Guilt? Blaze and his Father? MAKE UP YOUR MIND!!! The story sucks! One minute two characters are down one another's throat, the next the one is confessing his darkest secret. Characters are Inconsistent! One minute Blaze is a laid back fun loving guy, the next he's ominously pushing everyone away. This is okay, but show me some character development. A little bit of drama would be appreciated. Acting? What's Acting? One word: Mendes! I don't know why you keep getting movie roles but STOP...please. You are the worst actress to ever grace the Silver Screen. Please, for the love of GOD, stop making movies. More importantly, Stop making movies that I would go and see. The sock puppets on Lamb-Chop could act better! WHY WHY WHY!!! This movie sucked and I don't know why anyone liked it. If you are one of those people, please stop going to the movies. Stop encouraging the world that films like this are worth while. To top it all off this came out on my birthday! Happy Birthday to me! Here's the worst comic book movie ever! Yeah!!!

Review title: Did we go to see the same movie the critics did?
Review_body: My wife and I went and sat for Ghostrider this weekend and really enjoyed ourselves. Sure, some of the dialogue was overwrought and took itself too seriously but I really think Cage's performance more than balanced that out. This is a movie that with some dialogue changes would have been amazingly good but just ended up being an entertaining sit. In some of the reviews I read they mentioned Cage's character wearing a black Elvis wig. That wasn't in the version we saw at all. Perhaps part of why we enjoyed it so much was that we hadn't been exposed to the source material so we were able to enjoy Cage's version of Johnny Blaze more than if we'd gone in with a characterization already in mind.

Review title: Not hugely enjoyable and not very well written
Review_body: Just saw this film and to be honest i fell asleep twice. The basic premise of the story and trailers sounded good. I've always liked Marvel comics, but this was really a bad advert for comic-to-movies!! The worst part seemed to be the script, all good stories have a beginning/middle/end. This one started out bad, there was no depth of explanation to the characters, i'm still a little vague about the mad bad guy and who he was (not the devil the other chap)and why he was bad and therefore why he was so scary. The other little helpers he had i had know idea who they were, why they were bad and therefore why they were supposed to be scary. Without having a beginning to set the scene the baddies lacked any reason to be scared of them. The special powers of the goody didt seem all too special either, so it was hard to know if he had some magic trick up his sleeve. The end was cheesy and weird and it was difficult to muster up any support for the character when there was no character depth to explore what exactly it was he was fighting for. All this was backed up by approx 30 people walking out before the end, it reminded me of England vs Spain, lots of hype, but delivering spectacularly short!

Review title: An action movie without the action and twice the lead-up
Review_body: I went into this movie with zero expectations, having not read the comic books and seeing the preview only once. However, coming out the other end, I wish I had not bothered.Flaming skulls are cool, no-one is denying that; but this movie is not. Although the first point has been beaten to death, Cage sucks. He's got some good movies, granted, but this isn't one of them. This movie is just lame; the lines are cheesy, the characters are cookie-cut from the dough of Hollywood, and whatever cool fight scenes might have saved this movie are null. I can appreciate not having explosions at every turn in a movie, but this was one where I was consciously bored, waiting for the characters to stop being try-hard and cool and start blowing stuff up to entertain me. The flaming chain whip seemed like it had potential.But no. Despite the lead-up to the dispatch of each of the four main baddies, each one is destroyed within a few minutes each. There are no cool drawn-out fight scenes which destroy half the city in the process, but rather the Ghost Rider is given powers so that he can end any fight before it gets good. I described it to my friends as, "an action movie without the action and twice the lead-up". Granted, the motorbike scenes are kind of cool, but the fact that the Ghost Rider is seemingly invincible takes any suspense out of it and just leaves you wondering how long until it's over.You may think that at least the final fight scene would be cool. You would be wrong.I could stand this movie if it had action in it - you know, like an action movie should - but it has extremely little. It is minute after minute of lame characters, uninteresting love interests, and boring dialog. The final scene made me cringe more than the entire movie thus far; it was just that predictable. Just _don't_ waste your time.

Review title: Spawned from the shallow end of the gene pool
Review_body: This turd was served unto me thanks to my 13 yr old. I expected an evening reminiscent of Chuck E Cheese birthdays parties- you suffer through it for the kid, but if a little creative, you can find ways to enjoy yourself. Its for the kiddo, fine. We pay the fees. We sit. We chat and laugh. Time well spent with my offspring.... and then this turd falls into our lap and something that can only be described as torture began. We stayed. We persevered. We have overcome. However, this film adds yet another nail into the coffin of our society. The idea that there a significant percentage of people who enjoyed this movie scares me. They "thought" it was great. There is a reason why this movie was made. There is a reason why there is a mile of cleavage 4" per frame. There is a reason Peter Fonda cameoed (which was a most unexpected irony). There is a reason that any depth or substance was removed and replaced with flames, explosions, cheesy graphics/effects, 200 C/D cup extras in tight low cut shirts, and the underlying theme of this stool sample. it was as if the creators intentionally attempt to hypnotize you with the sub-par special effects. Its as if the creators were making a film for a nation of testosterone fueled high school quarterbacks that live in the projects. I can just picture the campus military recruiter taking his prey out to see this on a Friday night. WHOA!! that was Awesome!!.... well that is kinda dumb, Why is th... WHOA!! Did you see those t!ts?!!.... HM...DAMN!!! did you see that Harley? WOW!!!" The military needs a few good men just like you boys. I got up to leave and as we were walking out, the helicopters were flying into the stadium. It was too much. I stood in awe and found myself to mesmerized. "Are they f*cking serious??" It was over the top and like a toothache, I couldn't leave it alone. We stayed just to see how far this would be taken. With the country being at "war", you have to expect Hollywood to step up and provide plenty of "feel good" movies for family members and even more Gun-ho movies to inspire future recruits. It's become so commonplace that subtle isn't even necessary. Apparently, neither is depth or intelligence. Edward Bernays would be proud. As a matter of fact, this is EXACTLY what Bernays would do. Unjustified and unsupported war that the country cannot back out of.... in fact it requires more support... HM... let's see- people are stupid and they are dangerous in masses. Aha! Solution- use emotion. Use the media. Make retarded films for retarded masses and then stir up their emotions. Irrational and emotional are keys to control. I really wish people would wake up. Watch the ending as the "hero" denies his personal life and his love so that he may go fight crime and somehow spite Mephisto for killing his father. The World Trade Center should have been in the background with some firefighters logo fading out with a transparent flag slowing flowing in the wind.... This film IS the dumbing down of our society. This is the catalyst for our retardation. This type of "entertainment" along with video games are crucial right now. This is the realization I have come to from reading and learning history. This film appears to be made at the request of the DOD or least partially financed by them. The Nazi's weren't the only ones with propaganda, nor were they the best at it... It will be a long time before I return to the theater because of this film. If by some remote chance, I am blowing this out of proportion and simply being paranoid- then it will get better. Soon our troops will be home and Hollywood will go back to making decent films. If not, it is only going to get worse as the entropy increases and more aggressive measures are taken. BTW- Frank Miller's "300" (a glorious and heroic depiction of Sparta) is coming soon to theater near you... uh oh.

the summary from another review """Hell of a Ride""" .Was this a hell of a ride ? Not more than a Tom & Jerry cartoon . This movie should have never been released in theaters . This is a movie where the trailer is the best part of it ,what i mean is that all you get from the movie is in the trailer : some special effects . Usually when I leave from the theaters the people are talking about the movie they've just seen ,this is not the case . If you want to see this movie don't see it alone take some friends with you so that you can talk about something else in the 114 min . For example Spider-Man is 100 times better then this . Waste of time .

Although I enjoyed this movie, I don't feel it should be rated PG-13. There were a lot of scenes that were too graphic for a child of this age. My husband felt that since it was related to Marvel Comics, that it was aimed at kids. From the previews I'd seen, I thought it was too scary for our kids. I checked the rating, and then permitted them to watch. Had I watched it first, like I should have, I would not have allowed them to see it. The story behind it is that the Ghost Rider is a good guy, but some of the scenes were more like R-rated vampire movies I've seen. Most PG-13 movies I let my kids watch revolve around bodily function humor and sexual innuendos. I did not expect this movie to be as scary as it was, for kids. They said they weren't afraid of it, but my daughter did cover her eyes a few times. We'll see how she sleeps tonight!

It was actually pretty entertaining, though some parts were lame and/or too predictable.out of 10 stars for each category...plot: 10 stars...amazing action: 10 stars...very nice comical effects: 10 stars drama effects: 8 stars...could've been better stunts: 9 stars,they were really good, but something inside me tells me not to give it quite a 10 special effects: 7 stars, they were very good, but some seemed kind of cheesy. For the sound effects, even if it really was Nicolas Cage's voice for the Ghost Rider (just toyed with a lot), it could've soundly, I don't know, fairly realistic choice in actors: 9 stars...Nicolas Cage did great, and so did most of the others, but young Johnny Blaze, or the person that played him, was a horrible actor, I'm sorry, but...script: 6 stars...okay, okay! some parts were really good! But, other parts left an undesirable after taste, it's just that for half of the major lines in the movies, you knew what the next line or word was. Way to predictable, and some parts, a little to lame. The script is the most important part!! make it good! Review title: Waste of what could have been good
Review_body: Being from Melbourne, I was interested in seeing what parts of Melbourne were in the film. I recognised afew which was cool. Also saw some local actors and one guy who always plays a funny kind of guy in commercials produced locally.That was where my interest remained unfortunately. Even Nicholas Cage could not save this movie. The story line was really lacking. The puns and one-liners were nor really that funny and in most instances extremely cheesy.This could have been really good. Apart from the CG being a little lacking in parts, a good storyline would have held it together. Parts of the movie that really could have had you hanging onto your seat were really ordinary and abrupt. Some parts were extremely presumptuous and left me wondering why this or that was happening with no given explanation provided.Definitely wait for the DVD to get to your local video store. I wish I did.

I love a good action flick full of romance, dangerous stunts and eye-popping special effects. So, I was thoroughly entertained by Ghost Rider. I don't know why some people aren't going for it, just personal opinion and preference, I suppose. But this is my kind of film. I love danger, great fighting sequences, and the fact that you can really sympathize for Johnny's situation, because despite the flaming skeleton deal, the rest is very believable. I want to go see it a few more times in the theater, it gets my approval for fun action flick that is plenty entertaining, and I hope for sequels to follow. I think it's nice to see a comic book character seldom talked of...as opposed to the ones that we all know so well, and then complain if something isn't done just by the book. I knew very little about the comic Ghost Rider, but would actually enjoy reading it now that I've seen the flick.Good stuff :-)

I generally will go see a comic book movie because I'm a geek like that. Sometimes it's a good thing, like when you get to see Spiderman or Batman Begins. Not so good when you have to sit through movies like Ghost Rider.The script: Fair storyline, lots of incongruencies, but just don't think about them too hard. Don't let your brain dwell on the dialogue either. It felt like something out of an 80's action cartoon. I swear I heard Peter Fonda use the phrase "I want you to destroy him!" The acting: I love drawly Nicholas Cage as much as the next person, but every time he was on screen, I found myself wishing his skull would catch on fire again. Wes Bently gave the best performance, and had the least amount of dialogue -- That may not be a coincidence. Stunning performance by Eva Mendez's chest. The action: Loaded up with special effects, but horribly unimaginative.I thought one would be able to CG some really creative action sequences with a flaming chain weapon-thingy, but no, he just kind of swung it around a bit. It was pretty disappointing.If you could sit through Daredevil or Fantastic Four, you can get through this one. I wouldn't recommend anyone watching it otherwise.

I cant stress how bad this film is....so I wont....but trust me, its absolutely abysmal Some of the scenes and 1-liners r so bad, u can only laugh! Don't know what N.Cage was doing in a film like this but this is definitely one of the worst films I've ever seen - and I've seen a few, I used to work at a cinema! Truly awful - do not waste your money....I'm laughing right now at how bad it was...the ghost rider oozes cheese, appalling 1-liners, poor effects, the story-line is very poor - this was truly a film made for some quick cash and not a lot of thought was put into it. the 'bad guys' in the film seem pointless - N.Cage kills them in such silly little ways that they weren't worth including in the film. and the attempts to scare you were truly abysmal...the care bears could have done a better job....'LOOK INTO MY EYES!'..i MEAN...COME ON?! The ghost rider says: 'YOUR STARTING TO P*SS ME OFF!'...correction....THIS FILM IS P**SING ME OFF!' ......appalling film...the screen was quite packed and at first it was only me and my friends who seemed to realise how bad it was from the first couple of scenes but by the end, the whole audience was in stitches at the cringe-worthy 1-liners and action scenes.....'YOU'RE INNOCENT!' oh dear! you know what, I've changed my mind, go see it, its gotta be comedy of the year. Marvel comics would be ashamed...they should stop cashing in on any possible film for their characters. i thought daredevil was bad and others alike but this is definitely the worst. Eva Mendez, nice cleavage but other than that....there was noting i liked...well, the ghost riders duo storming through the desert on bike and horse was quite amusing....that was until i realised i paid a fiver for this crap and could have been doing some important university work instead, but thats life...we all make mistakes....and this was one of mine...2 hours of my life ill never get back. ill survive, it was traumatic but life must go on.....

The story is 30 YEARS OLD.If you did not like this Marvel movie, then there is no reason why watching coming new Spider-man 3 or Fantastic 4 rise of silver surfer.Because you will be bitchy again.And next time when you go see a new comic movie,make sure you know what's about & understand more better.By ADAM

Review title: The worst film in the history of man, no exaggeration.
Review_body: This film was, without doubt, the worst I have ever seen...bearing in mind I had the fortitude to endure 'It's a Boy-Girl Thing' with my sanity intact this is no mean comment. Truly the most embarrassing, ass-clenchingly oh-my-sweet-Jesus-did-he-feckin-say-that? script, with the the arrogance to believe some cheap special effects are enough to fob off the audience. An absolute creative car crash..I beg you, down on two knees to never, ever, even in your darkest moments of depression, insanity or whimsy to indulge in this worthless piece of mass-produced Hollywood SFX pap. A truly sickening waste of money that lumbers between scenes with all the grace of an amputee elephant falling through a series of windows onto a grease covered ice rink. Don't watch it. Just don't. Maybe, at a stretch, it had enough creative capacity to fill a mediocre marvel comic hour Saturday morning cartoon. Absolutely HORRENDOUS...in my opinion the ultimate in banal, writing by numbers, creatively moribund rubbish. Take heed, please.

Review title: Does what it says on the tin...
Review_body: This film isn't an academy award winner but it does provide thrills and spills. If you want an in-depth commentary on society this isn't for you but if you want a fast pace, thrilling, no brainer then watch this film and be prepared for non stop action. What's more out of a whole host of super or anti-heroes the Ghost Rider is the COOLEST of the bunch. He is UBER cool - there is just something about him that THRILLS and excites! He beats Hell Boy, Super Man, Spider Man and even Bale's Batman in to touch. The special effects are amazing and they are more than enough to make up for the slight weaknesses in the story line. Overall I am not usually one for this sort of a movie and usually find them tiresome and over done but I took a chance and I fell in love with the Ghost Rider! He definitely is without question the MAN .. the darkest and coolest of the bunch!

My issues with the movie (and if someone's already covered this - my apologies) were:1. After the Ghost Rider gets his face rearranged by a cop with a nightstick, all the Rider does in reaction is stick his jaw back in place and wave his finger like Dikembe Mutumbo (sp?)or Hulk Hogan and says "Ah, ah, ahhh". Childish. Even for a PG-13 rating. The Rider isn't supposed to be THAT forgiving. Solution: Zarathos (the Ghost Rider) is a DEMON from HELL. The least he could've done was grabbed the officer by the collar and said or done something more effective (which we might not be able to get into here) to scare the officer into thinking "not a great idea" than just wave his finger and say that line. The officer is no longer "innocent" in Zarathos' eyes after that and deserved more in my opinion. The guy tried to take his head off. Yes it's a comic book and a fantasy but c'mon. Wish this movie was produced to be rated R. 2. Wes Bentley's face isn't weathered enough to play Blackheart. Nicholas Cage's natural look is more threatening than Wes' - not to mention Sam Elliott's (and Wes is wearing makeup to make him look more sinister...he doesn't). Unfortunately for him he's too much of a babyface to pull this mean of a character off at this point. Solution: Cast an actor with a harder look or more of an edge. Side Note: The "Hidden Elemental" villains overall were about as threatening as the portrayal of "The Hand" in Elektra. These guys were written almost the same way. You didn't feel anything for them. Could've been cooler and should've been darker and given the Rider more of a fight. They were killed just as quickly as you got to know them. Not a ton of screen time for them. Sometimes people say "the movie could've been (X) minutes shorter". In this case the fights should've been longer. 3. Some of the delivery from the actors seemed forced or unnecessarily over-the-top. (ie: when Nicholas Cage calls Blackheart an S.O.#, and later when Peter Fonda goes into the Johnny Blaze "you'll pay for this" part of the dialogue) Solution: Another take and/or better directing of your actors. That said, I still enjoyed the movie enough to recommend seeing it if you're into good popcorn movies related to comic book characters. Special FX were cool especially on the side-by-side desert ride of the 2 riders. The positives outweigh the negatives on this movie. Being a fan of the Ghost Rider character and Marvel comics growing up, I had no expectations of this being as good as the Spiderman or X-Men flicks because it doesn't have the production manpower or budget of those...and the Rider was never an A-list character for Marvel anyway - but I liked it that way. He was cool to me. I thought Nicholas Cage was OK. Not a huge fan of his work, but this I could deal with. Eva Mendes is beautiful. Kudos to her for going thru with the self-deprecating scene between her and the waiter. Some actresses wouldn't allow their egos to do that. Sam Elliott bleeds cool. It won't be considered by the academy for best picture (it's not trying to be) but it's fun for anyone that likes Halloween season-type images. I will be getting the DVD and wouldn't mind a sequel produced equally or better.

Review title: another comic movie... when will they learn
Review_body: this movie is below average. just because there are well known actors and lots of effects does not excuse the fact that this movie sucks. the story jumps around too much. the villains are killed before we even know who they are. i think they tried putting too much into and hour and half. im a comic fan as well as a movie fan and i must say that the "story plots" are already written for you; in the comics. how do screenwriters and directors mess it up. there seems to be a trend forming with all of these different movies that have made the leap from the comic book to the screen. ie: elektra, daredevil, punisher, the hulk just to name a few. don't get me wrong there are some good comic movies out there. there's just so much material already available from the comic how do they go wrong?

Review title: I am so sorry that Wes Bentley's career is over :(
Review_body: Oh yes this was about the lamest film I have ever seen. I have to say, that I was very excited about the filmI am a comic fan, but not a fanatic or anything. My expectations may have been a little high, but still the movie was pretty awful. It is the only movie I have ever considered walking out on. It certainly had great potential, but truly the execution was off. Throughout the film bad blocking, very corny lines, and bad editing plagued a great comic movie idea. I think that the editing crew was aware of the failures. It was clear that they sliced out every possible plot transition, but were somehow able to keep the extensive camera time devoted to squished cleavage. Maybe this was to distract most people from the train wreck of a movie they had paid good money to see. Lines were always delivered like a bad high school play. They had the opportunity to save it with a little self mocking--you know Evil Dead style, but apparently, no one recognized how awful the script was even as they said it. What a shame. The director, producer, and even some of the cast deserve a penance stare for the mediocrity they have unleashed upon the world.

Who built the bikes they used? Were they built from scratch (custom creations, from the ground up), or were they based loosely on a production bike? The Ghost Rider bike looked like it could have been based on a Honda VTX 1800. I know that the police officer with the radar gun had either an ST1100 or ST1300 police model. I enjoy the fact that they have gone back and done the superhero movies again (spiderman, superman, batman, daredevil, elektra, and although I thought it was cheesy, the incredible hulk). I do think they should to Aquaman with Michael Phelps! It was a pretty good story, but I would like to see it be sustainable over a series of movies, like spiderman, preferably with the same cast. Sam Eliot was a great addition to the cast as the OLD Ghost rider...

Review title: A dismal waste of good comic book characters
Review_body: Bad writing, bad directing and bad casting make this one of the worst Marvel adaptations for the big screen (on par with King Kull). Why the producers felt that Nick Gage was the best choice for Johnny Blaze will be a mystery much debated over the years. I am not sure why Johnny became more country as he grew up but I guess Nick is real proud of his over the top Southern/hick accent and he hasn't got to use it since "Conair". The producers would have been better served by letting Matt Long play Johnny for the entire film. While Eva Mendes reminds me visually of Barbara Carrera, she lacks Barbara's fire, making all of her scenes with Nick, in a word, boring. The story was certainly appropriate for a comic book, but even DC comics would have avoided the plot holes that permeated this production.

Review title: So horrible I couldn't watch the whole thing
Review_body: Okay, here's a basic summary of my experience of this movie. At the resort me and my friend were at for vacation, they had a free theater, and we decided to see ghost rider. We left forty five minutes after the start. The beginning sequence was cheesy and it did not have the thrill the director wanted. When Johhny's father died and he was screaming NOOOOOO!!! I wanted to join him. But not for the same reasons. And how it suddenly switched to Cage, I was so confused, my friend had to explain what happened to me. It gave no summary of how he got there or who he was. And then the thing with the element people. The whole standoff between the devil and his son, even six years would be able to see through that whole father "shock". The elements are so sad, one punch and earth is screaming mercy. He did have powers, but he used a truck. Sad. And the ghost rider himself, his entire dialog consisted of cheesy one liners, which i guess was supposed to have an effect. And the grave keeper, who knew so much about the ghost rider. Gee, wonder who he was? I left after that, but that was pretty easy to figure . I was completely disgusted with the movie.

I've always said to myself that there is nothing that will take you for a wild spin than a good hard pounding, special effects, action packed movie & 'Ghost Rider' simply did just that. Now, i know that there are a lot of critics out there commenting on the movie's extensive plot, mainly referring to the dialogues & Cage's 'bad acting' & i don't blame them yes i do agree a bit that the movie was kind of sloppy in the middle but what can you say, c'mon lets go into comparison when 'Fantastic Four' was released two years ago everyone thought that it was gonna blow their heads & eyes off but it did'nt really keep it's words did it? no it did'nt create that much impact as everyone thought it would thus, in the end it was a major loss to the producers. Now lets go back to ghost rider people u gotta understand it was the debut of a new superhero movie you can't always expect every movie to be major blockbuster in one day, you have to give it a another chance and lets see what the next sequel has to offer us.

Review title: Wait until it comes on broadcast TV then turn it off.
Review_body: Cartoon based or not, this has to be one of the great all time stinkers right up there with The Gauntlet, Con Air and Showgirls. I can't imagine any reason why Cage and Elliott agreed to act in this movie other than money. They have made a lot of good movies in the past and I usually enjoy their work. This movie also demonstrated one other fact. Peter Fonda inherited none of his father's acting ability. Like this is a surprise. They could have pulled a guy off the street, given him 10 minutes to brush up on the lines and he would have done a better job. This movie was so bad I'm going to ask the satellite company for my money back.

Ghost Rider was not as bad as some say it was, but then again it wasn't as good as some say it was. It had little originality of its own, the romance was cheap and frivolous without a thought to it, and most of the actors were not suited at all to the film, and their roles were jokes. The only one who, I felt, gave a decent performance was Peter Fonda.However, on a lighter note, the action was appropriate and the special effects to boot. Despite the obvious cheesy hilarity of this movie, it could have had a chance at being something, had the lines been classier and more original, and the scenes less unintentionally funny, and the actors less willing to admit that they are, "FAKE FAKE IT'S ALL FAKE."
